numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a belief of young adults in some first world countries.
2. The US is a first world country.
3. Japan is a first world country.
4. Germany is a first world country.
5. Some young adults in the US believe that the world is becoming a better place.
6. Some young adults in Japan believe that the world is becoming a better place.
7. Some young adults in Germany believe that the world is becoming a better place.
8. Some adults who are older than 40 years in the US believe that the world is becoming a better place.
9. Some adults who are older than 40 years in Japan believe that the world is becoming a better place.
10. Some adults who are older than 40 years in Germany believe that the world is becoming a better place.
11. The belief of young adults in the US is stronger than the belief of adults who are older than 40 years in the US.
12. The belief of young adults in Japan is stronger than the belief of adults who are older than 40 years in Japan.
13. The belief of young adults in Germany is stronger than the belief of adults who are older than 40 years in Germany.
14. Indonesia is not as developed as the US.
15. India is not as developed as the US.
16. Nigeria is not as developed as the US.
17. Indonesia is not as developed as Japan.
18. India is not as developed as Japan.
19. Nigeria is not as developed as Japan.
20. Indonesia is not as developed as Germany.
21. India is not as developed as Germany.
22. Nigeria is not as developed as Germany.
23. In Indonesia, each generation has a high percentage of people who believe that the world is becoming a better place.
24. In India, each generation has a high percentage of people who believe that the world is becoming a better place.
25. In Nigeria, each generation has a high percentage of people who believe that the world is becoming a better place.
26. In Indonesia, the percentages are equal across generations.
27. In India, the percentages are equal across generations.
28. In Nigeria, the percentages are equal across generations.
29. I wonder why Indonesia is an optimistic country.
30. I wonder why many people in Indonesia say that the world is getting better in each generation.
31. I wonder why some older generations in first world countries do not believe that the world is becoming a better place.
32. I wonder why these older generations believe this less than adults in less developed countries.
33. I am part of the generation of people who are 15 to 24 years old.
34. This topic relates to me.
35. I believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
36. Many people learn new ideas.
37. Many people are exposed to more concepts throughout the world.
38. Social media exposes many people to more concepts throughout the world.
39. The headline is: Am I the reason for the world's progress?
